content.description: Start on good holds and figure out how to get to the next set of jugs.  Most campus but there is some toe hook beta as well.  Once the next set of jugs have been obtained head up on easier moves to one more tricky move to get established on the face.  Keep it together for the high topout and beware of any Hueco choss.
content.protection: A few pads, the topout while high gets easier as you go.
content.location: Located behind the Aircraft Carrier Boulder.  Pass between the wall and the Aircraft Carrier.  As you come to a large gully turn left and the problem will be in front of you.  Winged Victory faces NE.

content.description:
The sucktastic climb that is Locksmith is completely redeemed with the low start in the big hueco.  Undercling to the crimp and toe-hook to acquire a right hand.  Here's where it gets tricky as the toe release can send you off.  Figure out the balance then throw to the start hold of Locksmith while keeping your feet off the pads.  Finish out on Locksmith.   

  This appears to be a newer route but has excellent movement rivaling the classic of the area.
content.protection: Several pads with spotters to move them around as you progress
content.location: Under the roof at The Locksmith

content.description: Sit start on the obvious jugs about 10 feet further in the cave, and then finish The Fin.Â
Starting on the obvious jug, pull a couple easy moves going right to set up for a rather big throw to the positive lip with an easy top out.
content.location: Opposite of the aircraft boulder on the downhill side left of the crack.

content.description: The venerable classic, and the main reason to drop your pads at the Aircraft Carrier.   Start on the head-height jug moving into the arete with a couple positive holds, then a sloping side-pull.  Use your arete skills to gain balance for the lip, or just move into it with some swing.  Finish slightly left.
content.protection: Many pads for height and slightly variable exit trajectory
content.location: Front and center as you approach the Aircraft carrier.

content.description: Start underclings and find cryptic sequence through roof to gain the lip. Trend right and up. The Wilder guide doesn't give this climb much love, but it has great movement. The Wilder guide also gives this climb a V9, but once the beta is unlocked, this problem is more in the ball park of a solid V7 or soft V8.
content.location: The roof problem that starts matched on underclings to the right of The Fin if one is facing the rock.

content.description: Climb up great rock on huecos and rounded holds with some pretty long reaches. Committing moves through the middle portion of the problem. Might be dusty due to lack of traffic.
content.location: Walk around behind the Aircraft Carrier, between it and the wall that is behind. You will come to a gully and Winged Victory will be to your left, cross the gully and come to another not too far beyond it, this is the Doldrums Gully. There is a large boulder that sits over the top of the gully. Anything but Dull climbs the wall to the right of the "jor, ber, stef" graffiti to a slightly lower lip than the problems to the left. it is also up the gully slightly from where the boulder sits above.

content.description:
Home of the classic, The Fin and several climbs from V3 to V12 with varying style; one-move wonders, long traverses, roof climbs, an arete and ass-draggers like Snake Belly where you can hardly fit a pad between you and the ground for 10 moves.   

  Sitting at the top of the hill it's exposed and gets a bit windy.  The carrier itself is mostly in the shade but the opposing wall gets some sun.
